The roads of Bree-land are beset by marauding Wargs, bolder and cleverer than the land has known in many years. The Thain of the Shire has been slow to react, for (say the rumors) something else darkens his thoughts. The Thain has welcomed odd visitors into his home, and he has kept everyone tight-lipped about what troubles him so. With the Thain so distracted, the task falls to you to secure the Shire, as only bold heroes dare travel the wilderness in these troubled times…

—description from the publisher

Name: 手札のないトリテ (No Hand)
Description:
In æ‰‹æœ­ã®ãªã„ãƒˆãƒªãƒ† (No Hand), a trick-taking game, rather than being dealt a hand of cards, a number of cards are flipped face up to the table and the players then draft which one they have played.

At the start of the game, each player is dealt a card which relates to the conditions for the current hand, such as diamonds are trump, or players do not need to follow suit.  Each player also then passes that card to their left.

Play then proceeds through 10 tricks with a dealer setting out cards one trick at a time, and the players marking with a colored cube which card they will have played.  Once the 10 tricks have been "played", the players bid on how many tricks they have won, and the condition cards are revealed.  Players will score points based upon the accuracy of their bid and which cards they had knowledge of at the beginning of the game.

Name: Merchants Cove: The Dragon Rancher
Description:
Dragons are the hottest steeds in demand—and you, Dwelma Draketooth, have the market cornered. As a seventh-generation dragon rancher, your last name is associated with the most sought-after serpents in the 5-Realms. Yet it’s not all glamorous! Young dragons are a handful to raise: they are fussy eaters, require lots of room to grow, and leave behind huge, steaming piles... Do you have what it takes to maintain the ranch and the Draketooth Dragons pedigree?

The Dragon Rancher is a new merchant you can play as. It is centered around a mix of bag-building and mancala-style mechanisms, where you draw food and drop it on your board, piece by piece. Once food is placed, the young dragons can follow the trails—and grow bigger with every bite!

—description from the publisher

Name: Colorado-opoly
Description:
There’s Something Magical About This Place!

Maybe it’s the take-your-breath-away beauty of nature combined with the high altitude and more than 300 sunny days a year. It’s not surprising that “America the Beautiful” was inspired by a trip to the summit of Pikes Peak.

Colorado-Opoly allows players to collect favorite Colorado properties and increase the rent by adding Cabins and trading them in for Lodges. We’re talking everything from Buffalo Burgers to the majestic Rocky Mountains! It’s all fun and games until someone has to BOW TO THE PLOW and is snowed in for three turns.

Grab your token and advance to Go Colorado! You may soon be hitting the slopes…or out of the game from eating too many Rocky Mountain Oysters. Whatever happens… IT’S GONNA BE… MILE HIGH FUN!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Edge: Dawnfall – Rha'zack Destiny Titan Resin
Description:
Huge, resin miniature together with expansion. Not meant for PvP games, only for Solo play!

Product Description:
Important!
These bossess are NOT the same as bosses from the plastic expansion - they are not meant to be playable in PvP mode. The models are also bigger in scale - the same ones as in the first Edge print.

Highest Quality resin
Huge sculpt (up to 15 cm high!)
Perfect for collectors
Comes unpainted and un-assembled
Brings additional solo gameplay

INCLUDES:
High Quality resin miniature
5 AI cards
2 additional scenario

Name: Micro Martians
Description:
Micro Martians is a pocket-sized tile drafting game about building a colony on Mars.

Players compete to provide the most benefit to the colony by building modules depicting a variety of resource symbols.

To start the game, 32 double-sided tiles are shaken up and scattered on the playing surface.

Each turn, a player may gather a resource, or spend resources to build one of the available modules.

When one player can no longer complete an action, the game ends, and players score based on how many kinds of symbols they collected, as well as collecting the most symbols of each kind.

The game officially supports 2-3 players, but is manageable with up to 5, and as a solitaire puzzle, wherein the player(s) try to place all of the modules before the resources become deadlocked.

—description from the designer

Name: Say What You See, Music Edition
Description:
This music based quiz game is laugh-out-loud funny and easy to pick up and play in no time. Ideally suited to three or more players, the game can be played by anyone with a love for music! The game comes with 100 catchphrase cards, each with a different well-known artist, song, or musical phrase that the player must guess by deciphering the pictogram clues.

Each clue is a representation of a famous name or phrase, so all the guesser needs to do is say what they see for the answer to seem obvious. Pictogram or Rebus style games have been hugely popular for generations, using images, symbols, or clever wordplay to denote meaning that is often clearest when read aloud. With a retro style box designed like a classic cassette, Say What You See: Music Edition makes can be neatly stored away when not in use. Full instructions included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Museum: The Historians
Description:
The historians will allow you to commit objects to be studied, temporarily removing them from play. This object will then need to be moved along the research track. However, the pursuit of knowledge isn't' free, and to fund your research, you'll have to pay with Prestige Points.

Once the object reaches the end of the track, your Historian will have unlocked all of its secrets. This will earn you an Expertise Emblem, either from the Object's Civilisation or Domain. At the end of the game, any collections of the corresponding Civilisation or Domain that you score will be worth additional points.

Name: Kosmonaut ärgere dich nicht: Wettflug zum Mond
Description:
Translated into English as 'Cosmonaut, does not annoy you - race to the moon' This space theme roll and move dice game has players travel a path from earth to the moon with space stations along the way.

Certain spaces on the board help the player while other spaces hinder their progress to the moon. First player to get to the moon is the winner

The game was a supplement to the book "Cosmonauts Primer" by Horst Hoffmann, The Children's Book Publisher Berlin, 1964. Publisher: Der Kinderbuchverlag Berlin (Germany)

—user summary

Name: Houses Of Knowledge
Description:
In Houses Of Knowledge, players  take the roles of curators trying to build the most diverse and impressive museum possible. But beware, as museum curation is a cut throat world, and your competitors will not hesitate to steal items from your museum to place it in theirs, disrupt the market to get better prices, or use talented PRs to raise their revenue.

Houses Of Knowledge is a collection game tasking players with placing items in thematic rooms in their museums. The first player to reach eight or more items on display will trigger the end game condition, as long as items or action cards are still available. Items on display bring more revenue which is used to buy rooms, more items, but also action cards.
Action cards take the shape of different characters.Each of them offer different perks, such as protecting your museum, reorganising the market or stealing cards from your opponents' hand.

Houses Of Knowledge relies on the capacity of the players to use the different actions efficiently in potentially huge combinations of cards synergies during their turn, while trying to prevent other players to do the same.

—description from the publisher
